structure.unit: OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH OF EMPLOYEES

text.section:
This chapter applies to all employers, employees, and places of employment throughout the Commonwealth except the following:
Employees of the United States government.
Employers, employees and places of employment over which federal agencies other than the Occupational Safety and Health Administration of the United States Department of Labor exercise statutory authority to prescribe or enforce standards or regulations affecting occupational safety and health.

Nothing in this chapter shall be construed to supersede or in any manner affect any workers' compensation law or to enlarge or diminish or affect in any manner the common law or statutory rights, duties, or liabilities of employers or employees, under any law with respect to injuries, diseases, or death of employees arising out of, or in the course of employment.

law.history: Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 378, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1982. -- Created 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 251, sec. 3.
